used to change colors my personal favorite will be featured in a tutorial on the next page how to change colors there are many ways to change color in a crochet project there is no right or wrong way only what works best for you and your brain i use the method where you begin the stitch in the original color and switch to the new color when ending the stitch for this method you carry the yarn you re not using and it gets crocheted over in the color you are using step 1 start stitch in original color the original white yarn is grabbed and pulled out to the front the new red yarn is tucked under the stitch step 2 when getting ready to complete the stitch yarn over with new color and finish the stitch yarn over with the new red yarn and pull through and complete the stitch the original white yarn falls to the back inside be sure to pull both yarns to make sure the yarn underneath the stitches is as flat as possible don t pull too tight or you ll gather the project more than needed step 3 begin next stitch with new color the new red yarn is looped on the hook and ready for the next stitch the original white yarn will be tucked underneath the red stitches peppermint bun huggers needed materials red and white yarn medium worsted weight 4 5mm or 5 5mm hook i use a 5 5mm because my gauge is tight 1 inch hair ties 2 total stitch marker scissors sewing needle bun hugger with white yarn
